Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election resulted in the election of Vjosa Osmani (1, 4, 7, 10) as the new president of Kosovo (1, 4, 5, 7, 10). Osmani is a 38-year-old lawyer (4, 7) who was educated in the United States (4). The election was held on April 4, 2021 (1, 4, 7, 10) and was the second attempt at electing a president after the first attempt failed (1, 4). The event drew attention due to efforts by former president Donald Trump to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election in the United States (2). This was the fourth local election since Kosovo's declaration of independence in 2008 (3). The Kosovo Central Election Commission verified the participation of 90 political subjects (3). The election results showed a victory for the anti-establishment party Vetevendosje (9).

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election (4) was held to elect a new president for the Republic of Kosovo (6). The election was held in April 2021, with Vjosa Osmani (7) being elected as the new president (4, 7). The election was seen as a defeat for the ruling Vetevendosje party (2) and was held after the resignation of former president Hashim Thaci (10). It was also seen as a response to the COVID-19 pandemic (3). The election was marred by election fraud in some areas, resulting in a second ballot being held in October/November 2021 (1).

Timeline.Text: Kosovo's leftist Vetevendosje party wins the parliamentary election, with Albin Kurti as the likely new prime minister.
Glauk Konjufca is elected as the new Speaker of the Assembly, taking over as acting president until May 5.
Vjosa Osmani, a U.S.-educated law professor and Vetevendosje candidate, is appointed as Kosovo's new president.
Local elections are held in Kosovo, with 17 municipalities electing mayors in the first round and 21 more to vote in November.
The Supreme Court annuls a decision for a re-vote in Hani i Elezit due to election fraud.

Overview.Summary: Vjosa Osmani was elected as the president of the Republic of Kosovo in April 2021 (1,3,4,5,8,10). She is 38 years old and has a background in law, having studied at the University of Pittsburgh in the United States (4,9). Osmani is focused on improving the economy and integrating Kosovo into the European Union and NATO (4). She has also made an official visit to Austria in June 2021 (6). There were reports of her spending 39 euros per day on her trip to Albania in January 2021, but she has denied this and stated that all members of her delegation received the same amount (7). The European Union's commissioner for enlargement, Oliver Varhelyi, congratulated Osmani on her election (8).

Timeline.Text: Vjosa Osmani is elected as the President of Kosovo in the third round of voting.
Vjosa Osmani becomes the first female president of Kosovo.
Vjosa Osmani is congratulated by the EU Commissioner for Enlargement, Oliver Varhelyi.
Vjosa Osmani outlines her priorities as president, including the economy and integration into the EU and NATO.
Vjosa Osmani visits Austria on an official visit.
Vjosa Osmani visits Berlin and meets with German officials.

In addition to the presidential election, local elections were also held (5). The parliament of Kosovo held indirect elections for president (8). The elections were declared a public holiday by President Cyril Ramaphosa (7). The election was seen as a defeat of international influence in Kosovo (10).

Timeline.Text: The anti-establishment Vetevendosje party wins a landslide victory in the Kosovo parliamentary election.
Vjosa Osmani is elected as the new president of Kosovo by the parliament.
Kosovo holds its fourth local elections since declaring independence.
President Cyril Ramaphosa declares November 1, 2021 as a public holiday for the upcoming local government elections.

Albin Kurti is elected as the new Prime Minister of Kosovo by parliament.
Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu of the Guxo party is congratulated by President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on her victory in the Kosovan presidential election.
Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu is officially declared the 5th President of Kosovo.
Kosovo holds its fourth local elections since declaring independence, with 90 political subjects participating.
The results of the Kosovan local elections are analyzed as a defeat of international influence.
Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu is inaugurated as the new President of Kosovo.

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election (9) took place on February 14, 2021 (1, 3). Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu was elected as the second president of Kosovo (5) and is the youngest head of state in the world (5). The election was held after the resignation of Hashim Thaci (6). The election was recognized by the European Union (10) and was congratulated by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan (8). The election was also observed by the European Union (10).

Timeline.Text: The 2021 early parliamentary elections in Kosovo are announced for February 14th.
Parliamentary elections take place in Kosovo, with Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu winning the presidency.
Kosovo officially opens its embassy in Jerusalem after becoming the first Muslim-majority territory to recognize the city as Israel's capital.
Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu, 38, becomes Kosovo's new president, making her one of the youngest heads of state in the world.
Kosovo's parliament officially selects Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu as the country's new president.
Local elections take place in Kosovo, with 17 municipalities electing a mayor in the first round.
21 municipalities in Kosovo vote again in the local elections.
A Wikipedia page is created for the 2021 Kosovan presidential election.
The European Union deploys an Election Observation Mission in Kosovo for the local elections.
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan congratulates Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu on her election victory.

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election was held on April 4, 2021 (1, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18). Vjosa Osmani, a 38-year-old jurist, was elected as the new president (1, 6, 9, 12, 18). She is the first female president of Kosovo (5, 18). This was the sixth presidential election held since Kosovo's declaration of independence (14). The election was held after the resignation of the previous president, Hacim Thaci, who was facing criminal charges (5, 18). Osmani's party, Vetëvendosje, won a landslide victory with 48% of the vote (9, 18). This was the largest margin of support won in any election since the end of Serbian rule (18). Osmani's election was seen as a defeat for international influence in Kosovo (20). President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan of Turkey congratulated Osmani on her victory (19). The election also saw low voter turnout (7). The next local elections in Kosovo are scheduled for October 17, 2021 (4).

Timeline.Text: The parliamentary elections in Kosovo are held, with the Vetëvendosje party winning a landslide victory.
Vjosa Osmani is elected as the new president of Kosovo, succeeding Glauk Konjufca.
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan congratulates Vjosa Osmani on her election victory.
Local elections are held in Kosovo, with 17 municipalities electing mayors in the first round and 21 holding a second round on November 14.
